H0.text: They vibrate in place within a fixed volume, which best describes the motion of the molecules of a solid object.

H1.text: They move around freely within a fixed volume is the statement that best describes the motion of the molecules of a solid object.

H2.text: They vibrate in place and take the shape of a container best describes the motion of the molecules of a solid object.

H3.text: They move around freely and take the shape of a container is the statement that best describes the motion of the molecules of a solid object.

A4.text: Phonons are the quantum mechanical description of an elementary vibrational motion in which a lattice of atoms or molecules uniformly oscillates at a single frequency.

A5.text: If the lattice is rigid, the atoms must be exerting forces on one another to keep each atom near its equilibrium position.
